meanings.definition: To put an end to; suppress
meanings.sent1: The teacher was quashing the noise in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The police officer quashed the protest before it turned violent.
meanings.sent3: The magician quashed the rabbit back into its hat.
meanings.sent4: The superhero quashed the villain's evil plans with ease.
meanings.sent5: The rain quashing the flames made for a dramatic scene.

meanings.definition: To reject as invalid or void
meanings.sent1: The judge quashed the false evidence presented in court.
meanings.sent2: She quashed the rumors about her with undeniable proof.
meanings.sent3: The cat quashed the idea of sharing its toy with the dog.
meanings.sent4: His determination quashed any doubts about his abilities.
meanings.sent5: The storm quashing the picnic plans was disappointing but not unexpected.

meanings.definition: To crush or squash with force
meanings.sent1: The chef was quashing garlic cloves for the pasta sauce.
meanings.sent2: He quashed the bug with a swift motion of his hand.
meanings.sent3: The toddler quashed the playdough into a shapeless blob.
meanings.sent4: The weightlifter quashed the competition with his impressive strength.
meanings.sent5: The elephant quashing the watermelon made quite a mess.
